verses.text_plain: O that thou wert as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! when I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised.
verses.verse_html:
1O that thou wert as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! when I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; yea, I should not be despised. ▼
▼ I should not…: Heb. they should not despise me

tokens.text: thee; yea, I should not be despised

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I should not…: Heb. they should not despise me
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I should not…: Heb. they should not despise me

verses.text_plain: I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother’s house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.
verses.verse_html: 2I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother’s house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.

tokens.text: me: I would cause thee to drink

verses.text_plain: His left hand should be under my head, and his right hand should embrace me.
verses.verse_html: 3His left hand should be under my head, and his right hand should embrace me.

verses.text_plain: I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please.
verses.verse_html:
4I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please. ▼
▼ that…: Heb. why should ye stir up, or, why, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ that…: Heb. why should ye stir up, or, why, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ that…: Heb. why should ye stir up, or, why, etc

verses.text_plain: Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth that bare thee.
verses.verse_html: 5Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: there thy mother brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth that bare thee.

tokens.text: thee up under the apple tree

verses.text_plain: Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love is strong as death; jealousy is cruel as the grave: the coals thereof are coals of fire, which hath a most vehement flame.
verses.verse_html:
6Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm: for love is strong as death; jealousy is cruel as the grave: the coals thereof are coals of fire, which hath a most vehement flame. ▼
▼ cruel: Heb. hard

verses.text_plain: Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it: if a man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned.
verses.verse_html: 7Many waters cannot quench love, neither can the floods drown it: if a man would give all the substance of his house for love, it would utterly be contemned.

verses.text_plain: We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?
verses.verse_html: 8We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: what shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?

tokens.text: when she shall be spoken for

verses.text_plain: If she be a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she be a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.
verses.verse_html: 9If she be a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: and if she be a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.

verses.text_plain: I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.
verses.verse_html:
10I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: then was I in his eyes as one that found favour. ▼
▼ favour: Heb. peace

tokens.text: then was I in his eyes

verses.text_plain: Solomon had a vineyard at Baal–hamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.
verses.verse_html: 11Solomon had a vineyard at Baal–hamon; he let out the vineyard unto keepers; every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.

verses.text_plain: My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.
verses.verse_html: 12My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.

verses.text_plain: Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear it.
verses.verse_html: 13Thou that dwellest in the gardens, the companions hearken to thy voice: cause me to hear it.

verses.text_plain: Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices.
verses.verse_html:
14Make haste, my beloved, and be thou like to a roe or to a young hart upon the mountains of spices. ▼
▼ Make…: Heb. Flee away

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Make…: Heb. Flee away
